oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Davies Plantation Manor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: “Davies Manor -- 9336 Davies Plantation Rd., Brunswick, Shelby County, TN 38014 -- A two-story log colonial house built in part by an Indian chief before 1807. For many years the plantation home of brothers Logan E. and James B. Davies. Owned by Davies Manor Association, Inc. Headquarters for three hereditary-patriotic organizations: Zachariah Davies Chapter, NS., DAR; Old Stage Road Society, NS., CAR; Shelby Chapter, NS., SAR. Placed on the National Register of Historic Places, 1975.”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: residences; plantations; colonial houses; pioneer life;
